title: DINNER IN FIVE…
subtitle: This special issue is packed with five-ingredient recipes, but these weeknight winners rank among our most loved for those crazy-busy evenings. Each one makes it easy to bring supper to the table with minimal ingredients and effort.

components.text: 5-INGREDIENT RECIPES
Dinner in Five…

This special issue is packed with five-ingredient recipes, but these weeknight winners rank among our most loved for those crazy-busy evenings. Each one makes it easy to bring supper to the table with minimal ingredients and effort.
Easy Enchiladas

HANDS-ON 15 MIN TOTAL 35 MIN SERVES 4
SUBMITTED BY TANYAP
103 REVIEWS

components.html:
1½cups prepared low-sodium salsa, plus more for serving
1lb. ground beef
1(15.5-oz.) jar prepared salsa con queso
8(8-inch) flour tortillas
1(8-oz.) pkg. shredded cheddar-Monterey jack cheese blend

components.text: <lede>1.</lede> Preheat oven to 350°F. Coat a 9x13-inch baking dish with cooking spray and pour in salsa.

<lede>2.</lede> Cook beef in a large skillet over medium heat, stirring to break up lumps, until browned, about 10 minutes. Drain grease. Stir in salsa con queso until well blended. Spread about ⅓ cup beef mixture across middle of tortilla; roll into a cylinder. Transfer, seam side down, to baking dish with salsa. Repeat with remaining tortillas and filling. Sprinkle with cheese.
<lede>3.</lede> Bake until cheese is browned and bubbling, 15 to 20 minutes. Serve with additional salsa.
armagazine.com/easy-enchiladas
QUICK
PER SERVING (2 ENCHILADAS): 888 CAL; 48G FAT (26G SAT); 52G PRO; 66G CARB (4G FIBER, 6G SUGARS); 1,694MG SODIUM

“I used taco meat with about half a can of drained black beans and half a small can of drained diced jalapeños. Very happy with the result!”
– JOEL ANDERSON

“The only thing I do differently is to use canned enchilada sauce instead of salsa.”
– MELINA KNAUSS
Make It a Meal
Serve these beef enchiladas with lime wedges, tortilla chips, and chopped fresh cilantro.
Coconut Pork Curry

HANDS-ON 5 MIN TOTAL 25 MIN SERVES 4
SUBMITTED BY COOKMASTER2
1 REVIEW
Add extra spice to this curry with a sprinkle of crushed red pepper.

components.html:
1cup basmati rice
1¼lb. lean pork, cut into cubes
¼tsp. salt
1Tbsp. vegetable oil
1½cups sliced bell pepper (any color)
2cups sugar snap peas
1(16-oz.) jar Thai-style yellow coconut curry stir-fry sauce

components.text: <lede>1.</lede> Cook rice according to package directions.
<lede>2.</lede> Meanwhile, season pork with salt. Heat oil in a large saucepan over high heat. Cook pork until completely browned, about 5 minutes. Remove from pan.
<lede>2.</lede> Sauté bell pepper and sugar snap peas in saucepan until softened, 1 to 2 minutes. Return pork to pan.
<lede>3.</lede> Add stir-fry sauce to saucepan and bring to a simmer; cook, stirring occasionally, 5 to 10 minutes, until an instant-read thermometer inserted into thickest parts registers 145°F.
armagazine.com/coconut-pork-curry
HIDDEN GEM | QUICK
PER 1½ CUPS: 376 CAL; 22G FAT (11G SAT); 36G PRO; 10G CARB (2G FIBER, 4G SUGARS); 406MG SODIUM

“Not too spicy, and it had a terrific flavor.”
– THEDAILYGOURMET
Breaded Air Fryer Pork Chops

HANDS-ON 10 MIN TOTAL 20 MIN SERVES 4
SUBMITTED BY FRANCE C
55 REVIEWS

components.html:
4boneless center-cut pork chops, 1 inch thick (1½ to 1¾ lb. total)
2tsp. salt-free Cajun seasoning
¼tsp. salt
¼tsp. black pepper
2cups seasoned croutons (1.6 oz., 1¼ cups crushed) [You could swap in 1¼ cups seasoned panko bread crumbs.]
1egg

components.text: <lede>1.</lede> Preheat air fryer to 400°F. Season both sides of pork chops with Cajun seasoning, salt, and pepper.

<lede>2.</lede> Pulse croutons in a small food processor to a fine consistency (or, using a rolling pin, crush croutons in zip-top plastic bag). Transfer croutons to a shallow dish. In another dish, lightly beat egg. Dip pork chops into egg, letting excess drip off, then dredge in croutons. Put chops on a plate and spray with cooking spray.
<lede>3.</lede> Coat air fryer basket with cooking spray. Arrange chops in basket, making sure not to overcrowd. (You may need to do 2 batches depending on the size of your air fryer.)
<lede>4.</lede> Cook 5 minutes. Turn chops over; cook 4 to 5 minutes more or until an instant-read thermometer inserted into thickest parts registers 145°F.
armagazine.com/breaded-air-fryer-pork-chops
HEALTHY | QUICK
PER CHOP: 287 CAL; 9G FAT (3G SAT); 38G PRO; 13G CARB (1G FIBER, 1G SUGARS); 554MG SODIUM

“This is the first time I cooked pork chops in the air fryer. They turned out to be probably the juiciest chops ever.”
– GARY WOODS

“I couldn’t believe how good these were, and cleanup was so easy, too!”
– CARRIE HARRIS
Make It a Meal
Serve these easy breaded chops with sautéed green beans and/or mashed potatoes.
Slow Cooker Buffalo Chicken Lettuce Wraps

HANDS-ON 10 MIN TOTAL 2 HR, 40 MIN SERVES 10
SUBMITTED BY AC
52 REVIEWS

components.html:
2lb. boneless, skinless chicken breasts
1(1-oz.) pkg. ranch dressing mix
1(12-oz.) bottle hot pepper sauce, such as Frank’s RedHot
1head Boston lettuce, divided into leaves
Blue cheese crumbles

components.text: <lede>1.</lede> Put chicken in a 3½- to 4-qt. slow cooker. Sprinkle with ranch dressing mix; turn to coat. Pour hot pepper sauce over chicken.
<lede>2.</lede> Cook, covered, on High 2½ to 3 hours or on Low 5 to 6 hours.
<lede>3.</lede> Transfer chicken to a large bowl; shred using 2 forks. Strain liquid from slow cooker into another bowl to serve with wraps.
<lede>4.</lede> Spoon chicken into lettuce leaves, sprinkle with blue cheese, and roll up leaves. Serve with strained cooking liquid and sprinkle with blue cheese.
armagazine.com/slow-cooker-buffalo-chicken-lettuce-wraps
GLUTEN-FREE
PER WRAP: 117 CAL; 2G FAT (0G SAT); 21G PRO; 2G CARB (0G FIBER, 0G SUGARS); 1,206MG SODIUM

“I used chicken tenders. They were done after 4½ hours on Low, and then I shredded them. Perfectly tender, moist, and flavorful!”
– CHRISTINA
Baked Salmon Fillets With Dijon Mustard

HANDS-ON 10 MIN TOTAL 25 MIN SERVES 4
SUBMITTED BY CHRISTYJ
1,548 REVIEWS

components.html:
4(4-oz.) skinless salmon fillets
4tsp. Dijon mustard
¼tsp. salt
⅛tsp. black pepper
¼cup butter, melted
¼cup Italian-style panko bread crumbs
Lemon slices, for garnish

components.text: <lede>1.</lede> Preheat oven to 400°F. Line a shallow baking pan with foil and lightly coat with cooking spray.
<lede>2.</lede> Put salmon on foil. Spread a thin layer of mustard on fillets and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Stir together butter and panko in a small bowl; spread over salmon.

<lede>3.</lede> Bake in upper third of oven 11 to 13 minutes, or until salmon flakes easily with a fork and an instant-read thermometer inserted into thickest parts registers 145°F. Set oven to broil. Broil fish until lightly browned, 15 to 30 seconds. Garnish with lemon slices.
armagazine.com/baked-salmon-fillets-with-dijon-mustard
QUICK
PER 4 OZ. FILLET: 287 CAL; 19G FAT (8G SAT); 23G PRO; 5G CARB (0G FIBER, 0G SUGARS); 461MG SODIUM

“I’ve tried this with orange roughy, too, and it was just as great. So easy and impressive!”
– REBSLO
Make It a Meal
Serve these salmon fillets with steamed or roasted asparagus and packaged heat-and-serve rice pilaf.
